page.title: 18Local History
page.content: In the 19th century men used to smoke clay pipes. Burrowbridge was famous for the pipes which were made there. In the 1851 census there were 22 pipemakers recorded as living there. Recently a resident was digging in his garden and found hundreds of pieces of clay pipe which had obviously been there for many years. The Baptist Chapel has still got the rings mounted in the walls where people used to tie up their horses when they went to church. A lady now living in Moorland remembers being taken to school in a wagon drawn by a horse. Charcoal used to be made from the willows which grow on the moors. The most famous person associated with the area is King Alfred.
